definitions.definition: A kind of narrative poem , adapted for recitation or singing ; especially, a sentimental or romantic poem in short stanzas .
examples: The poet composed a ballad praising the heroic exploits of the fallen commander.
On Friday nights, the roller rink had a time-block called "Lovers' Lap" when they played nothing but ballads on the overhead speakers.
He was playing the guitar and singing a ballad to his girlfriend while she was playing the drums.
